results.title: The Pied Piper of Hamelin
results.creator_credit: Mark Hall, Brian Cosgrove and Cosgrove-Hall Productions
results.brief_description: An animated puppet film for children based on the poem by Robert Browning about the events in the town of Hamelin after a plague of rats invade the town. Narrated by Robert Hardy.

results.title: The Picture woman
results.creator_credit: Peter Rasmussen, Robert Reynolds, Victor Gentile, Australian Film Commission and Oracle Pictures
results.brief_description: A woman whose life has been photographed every day since birth looks back at her life and asks, “can a lifetime be embraced in one breath?”. (Awards: London Film Festival, 1998; Mill Valley Film Festival, 1998; Montreal Film Festival, 1998)

results.title: The Physicists: playing dice with the universe
results.creator_credit: Roger Hogen, D Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Describes the work of physicists as they experiment with ideas which few can comprehend. Tells how some are mapping the tiniest structures of matter, others are listening to the universe, hoping to discover intelligent life, and others are looking for black holes.

results.title: The Photographic vision
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description: This telecourse presents the technical principles of photography, the mechanics of the camera itself, the chemical and physical reactions which produce a permanent image and the use of various types of equipment and techniques to produce better quality photographs. The course explores the historical tradition in photography and the impact of the medium.

results.title: The Photographers
results.creator_credit: Jerry Sims, Christine Huneke and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Five of America’s top professional still photographers are seen here on assignments around the world. Includes Larry Burrows, Alfred Eisenstaedt, Mary Ellen Mark, John Dominis and Norman Parkinson.

results.title: The Photographer
results.brief_description: A whimsical sketch of a photographer in a small community, whose livelihood comes from understanding, and flattering, people’s vanities. As it presents a sampling of one day’s appointments, the film pokes gentle fun at the parade of human nature that passes before a photographer’s lens. Writen by Norman Klenman, photographed by Lorne C. Batchelor, narrated by William Hutt.

results.title: The Photo conductive effect
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Frank A. Hoare, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Katrina Rank
results.brief_description: Shows how the photo-conductive cell is highly sensitive to infra-red radiation. Illustrates various methods of detecting and measuring such radiation; history of research into the photo-conductive effect - Willoughby Smith’s experiments and Adam’s and Day’s work; composition of a photo-conductive cell and its working; the distance in spectral response curve between the different substances; operation of guided missiles, steel furnaces, and medical analysis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cons, Frank A. Hoare, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Katrina Rank

results.title: The Philippines: island republic
results.brief_description: The Philippines is a multi-island republic, with about half of its 7000 islands inhabited. Under the colonial rule of the United States, the democratic system of government was introduced, universal public education, and an all-weather road system. Reviews the agriculture, and economy of the islands and points out the relative prosperity.
